TopicTitle: FL-T400 Fuel Tank in real life!

Articles.Content:
I've been becoming a KSP superfan.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

How's it look? I made this last night.

It's made of paper, tape, glue, pencil and Sharpie markings, and a heavy duty cardboard tube that I needed to use a handsaw to cut and a file to smooth off.

Thanks for coming here,

Naten.
Now make lots of them and fill them with fuel.
The cat on the right is channeling Jeb.
Now make a SRB and make a sugar rocket out of it.

Thank you, all of you.

I am working on an Aeris 3A now, but I ran out of tape. The glue's taking a whiiiiiiillllle to dry, as in overnight. Last night, I just sat it down, so it should be fine now. And I haven't worked out the wing shape, and I probably won't make an Aeris 3A, come to think about it. The air intake is such a complex shape. I'll just be working on a ton of this stuff over a period of time. Thanks again for all of the support.

Cheers, sincerely, whatever,

-Naten

Can you make it a model rocket? Please?

Better yet, scale it up 50x and make it out of thick metal! I'm sure you can find high-grade liquid oxygen somewhere.

I'm working on a model rocket that looks like a KSP SRB, with 'winglets' on the bottom and, an 'Mk1 capsule' on the top attached by a 'stack decoupler.' I may make it into a thread if I ever get it done.

Anyways, nice job on a realistic-looking FL-T400!
I so want to do this with an SRB... Or one of the Jumbo 64 tanks.
